Metadata.name: Next × Cloudflare Starter
Metadata.title: Next × Cloudflare Starter — Minimal edge-ready Next.js stack
Metadata.description: Build with the App Router, package with OpenNext, and deploy to Workers without extra glue.

Blog.title: Blog — Next × Cloudflare Starter
Blog.description: Updates, notes, and patterns for shipping with Next.js on Cloudflare.

Home.title: A minimal Next.js + Cloudflare starter for serious product teams.
Home.subtitle: Build with the App Router, package with OpenNext, and deploy to Workers without extra glue. Ant Design v6 provides dependable components while Tailwind v4 handles layout and polish.

next.title: Next.js App Router
next.body: Modern routing and layouts with streaming-friendly defaults.

workers.title: Cloudflare Workers
workers.body: Edge deployment with fast cold starts and global reach.

opennext.title: OpenNext build
opennext.body: Transforms your Next.js output into a Worker runtime package.

Home.structureIntro: Keep everything in one place. Source lives in
Home.structureMiddle: configuration stays in the repo root, and OpenNext outputs to
Home.previewNote: Preview runs your build on the Cloudflare runtime before you deploy.

Blog.title: Shipping on the edge
Blog.subtitle: A small collection of practical posts about Next.js, OpenNext, and Cloudflare Workers.

edge.title: Why this starter keeps the edge sharp
edge.excerpt: Reduce cold starts, keep deploys simple, and let the App Router do the heavy lifting.

i18n.title: Internationalization without the overhead
i18n.excerpt: next-intl keeps translations typed and lean while hreflang stays correct by default.

deploy.title: From dev to Workers in minutes
deploy.excerpt: OpenNext packaging plus Cloudflare preview gives you confidence before shipping.
